place.name: CLOCAENOG
place.gazetteerText: CLOCAENOG (Isa and Ucha), a parish in Ruthin district, Denbigh; on a branch of the river Clwyd, near the border of Merioneth, 3 miles SSW of Ruthin town and r. station. Post town, Ruthin, Denbighshire. Acres, 6, 671. Real property, £2, 329. Pop., 439. Houses, 90. The property is divided among a few. Much of the surface is upland. An inscribed stone found here, and mention ed by Camden, is at Lord Bagot's seat of Pool Park. The living is a rectory in the diocese of St. Asaph. Value, £292.* Patron, the Bishop of Llandaff. The church is good; and there are charities £57. Fairs are held on Easter Tuesday and 24 Oct. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
